question:
Hurricane Humberto had been termed as an ‘extratropical cyclone’. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Extra-tropical cyclones are warm-cored structures while tropical cyclones are cold-cored.
  2. Only a tropical cyclone can transform into an extra-tropical cyclone and not vice versa.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Extra-tropical cyclones are cold-cored while tropical cyclones are warm-cored structurally. This means that the core of the extra-tropical cyclone is cooler than its surroundings. They are formed in the extra-tropical regions of both the hemisphere. They are associated with cold fronts or warm fronts. Statement 2 is incorrect: Extra-tropical cyclone can be formed from tropical cyclones and the vice versa is also true. A tropical cyclone may transform into an extra-tropical one when it moves pole-wards. They can be formed in either of the hemispheres. Cyclogenesis is another route of extra-tropical cyclone formation.
